stories.original_title: MaliciousCorgi: AI Extensions send your code to China
stories.generated_headline: Malicious AI Code Assistants Exfiltrate Developer Source Code to China
stories.summary: Two VS Code extensions, masquerading as AI-powered coding assistants, have been found secretly sending developer source code to China-based servers, with over 1.5 million combined installs.

stories.original_title: Claude Code is suddenly everywhere inside Microsoft
stories.generated_headline: Microsoft Integrates Anthropic's Claude Model into Core Products, Redefining AI Strategy
stories.summary: Microsoft has rapidly deployed Anthropic's Claude code across multiple platforms, signaling a major shift in its AI development approach and potentially altering the competitive landscape.

stories.original_title: Are we dismissing AI spend before the 6x lands? (2025)
stories.generated_headline: Experts Question Premature AI Spending Cuts Amidst Imminent 6x Performance Leap
stories.summary: As AI capabilities approach a significant inflection point, industry leaders are questioning whether companies are making a strategic mistake by cutting back on AI investments too soon.

stories.original_title: Actors: A Model of Concurrent Computation [pdf] (1985)
stories.generated_headline: Pioneering Concurrency: Revisiting the Actors Model in Modern Computing
stories.summary: This seminal 1985 paper by Carl Hewitt introduces the Actors model, a fundamental concept in concurrent computation that's still influencing AI and distributed systems today. Its relevance endures, offering insights into parallel processing and asynchronous communication.

stories.original_title: Message from Pope Leo XIV on the 60th World Day of Social Communications
stories.generated_headline: Pope Leo XIV Urges Reflection on Social Communications in Neural Age
stories.summary: In a message marking the 60th World Day of Social Communications, Pope Leo XIV emphasizes the importance of thoughtful engagement in the digital realm. The pontiff's remarks highlight the intersection of faith and technology.

stories.original_title: Towards a science of scaling agent systems: When and why agent systems work
stories.generated_headline: Unlocking the Secrets of Scalable Agent Systems: A Framework for Success
stories.summary: Researchers explore the science behind scaling agent systems, shedding light on when and why these systems work, and paving the way for more effective AI applications.

stories.original_title: My fast zero-allocation webserver using OxCaml
stories.generated_headline: Zero-Allocation Webserver Achieved with OxCaml, Pushing Performance Boundaries
stories.summary: A developer showcases a high-performance, zero-allocation webserver built using OxCaml, highlighting the language's capabilities in optimizing resource utilization.

stories.original_title: Nano-vLLM: How a vLLM-style inference engine works
stories.generated_headline: Unlocking Efficient AI Inference: A Deep Dive into Nano-vLLM's Architecture
stories.summary: Discover how Nano-vLLM's innovative inference engine optimizes performance and efficiency in large language models, and learn about its potential applications in various industries. This article provides an in-depth look at the technology behind Nano-vLLM.

stories.original_title: My iPhone 16 Pro Max produces garbage output when running MLX LLMs
stories.generated_headline: iPhone 16 Pro Max Struggles with MLX LLM Output Quality
stories.summary: Users report garbage output when running MLX Large Language Models on the iPhone 16 Pro Max, raising concerns about on-device AI performance. The issue may be related to optimization or compatibility problems.

stories.original_title: Show HN: NanoClaw – “Clawdbot” in 500 lines of TS with Apple container isolation
stories.generated_headline: Breakthrough in Compact Robotics: NanoClaw Redefines Autonomous Manipulation
stories.summary: NanoClaw, a 500-line TypeScript project, showcases a robotic arm's capabilities within Apple's container isolation, pushing boundaries in miniaturized robotics and AI integration.

stories.original_title: Two kinds of AI users are emerging
stories.generated_headline: The Great Divide: Two Distinct Profiles of AI Adopters Take Shape
stories.summary: As artificial intelligence continues to permeate various industries, two distinct categories of users are emerging, each with unique characteristics and approaches to AI adoption.

stories.original_title: Microsoft is walking back Windows 11's AI overload
stories.generated_headline: Microsoft Scales Back AI Features in Windows 11 Amid User Backlash
stories.summary: Microsoft is reevaluating its AI-driven approach in Windows 11, promising a more streamlined user experience. The move comes after critics slammed the OS for being overly reliant on artificial intelligence.

stories.original_title: MRI scans show exercise can make the brain look younger
stories.generated_headline: Exercise Linked to Younger-Looking Brain Structure in Adults
stories.summary: A new study using MRI scans reveals that regular exercise may contribute to a more youthful brain structure in adults, potentially combating age-related cognitive decline.

stories.original_title: Aging muscle stem cells shift from rapid repair to long-term survival
stories.generated_headline: Stem Cell Senescence: The Trade-Off Between Rapid Repair and Longevity
stories.summary: Researchers have discovered that aging muscle stem cells undergo a shift in priority from rapid tissue repair to long-term survival, revealing a complex trade-off between short-term functionality and cellular longevity. This finding has significant implications for the development of therapies targeting age-related muscle degeneration.

stories.original_title: Show HN: My Open Source Deep Research tools beats Google and I can Prove it
stories.generated_headline: Open-Source Research Tool Claims Superiority Over Google's Algorithms
stories.summary: A developer has introduced an open-source deep research tool, claiming it outperforms Google's search capabilities, with evidence to support the claim. The tool's efficacy and potential impact on the search landscape are generating significant interest.

stories.original_title: "Solving" Wordle from Shared Scores at 100%* Accuracy
stories.generated_headline: Researchers Achieve Perfect Accuracy in Retrospective Wordle Puzzle Solving Through Score Analysis
stories.summary: A new study demonstrates a method to accurately reconstruct Wordle puzzles from shared results, raising questions about the game's scoring system security.

stories.original_title: Clearspace (YC W23) Is Hiring an Applied Researcher (ML)
stories.generated_headline: Clearspace Seeks Top Talent to Drive AI Research Forward
stories.summary: Clearspace, a Y Combinator-backed startup, is looking for an applied researcher to join its team and push the boundaries of machine learning innovation.
